speaker: Soldier
text_entry: SCENE IV. Before the walls of Athens.

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: Trumpets sound. Enter ALCIBIADES with his powers

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Sound to this coward and lascivious town

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Our terrible approach.

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: A parley sounded

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Enter Senators on the walls

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Till now you have gone on and fill'd the time

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: With all licentious measure, making your wills

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: The scope of justice; till now myself and such

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: As slept within the shadow of your power

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Hav e wander'd with our traversed arms and breathed

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Our sufferance vainly: now the time is flush,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: When crouching marrow in the bearer strong

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Cries of itself 'No more:' now breathless wrong

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Shall sit and pant in your great chairs of ease,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: And pursy insolence shall break his wind

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: With fear and horrid flight.

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Noble and young,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: When thy first griefs were but a mere conceit,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Ere thou hadst power or we had cause of fear,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: We sent to thee, to give thy rages balm,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: To wipe out our ingratitude with loves

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Above their quantity.

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: So did we woo

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: Transformed Timon to our city's love

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: By humble message and by promised means:

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: We were not all unkind, nor all deserve

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: The common stroke of war.

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: These walls of ours

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Were not erected by their hands from whom

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: You have received your griefs; nor are they such

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: That these great towers, trophies and schools

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: should fall

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: For private faults in them.

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: Nor are they living

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: Who were the motives that you first went out;

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: Shame that they wanted cunning, in excess

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: Hath broke their hearts. March, noble lord,

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: Into our city with thy banners spread:

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: By decimation, and a tithed death--

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: If thy revenges hunger for that food

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: Which nature loathes--take thou the destined tenth,

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: And by the hazard of the spotted die

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: Let die the spotted.

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: All have not offended;

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: For those that were, it is not square to take

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: On those that are, revenges: crimes, like lands,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Are not inherited. Then, dear countryman,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Bring in thy ranks, but leave without thy rage:

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Spare thy Athenian cradle and those kin

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Which in the bluster of thy wrath must fall

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: With those that have offended: like a shepherd,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Approach the fold and cull the infected forth,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: But kill not all together.

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: What thou wilt,

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: Thou rather shalt enforce it with thy smile

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: Than hew to't with thy sword.

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Set but thy foot

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Against our rampired gates, and they shall ope;

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: So thou wilt send thy gentle heart before,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: To say thou'lt enter friendly.

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: Throw thy glove,

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: Or any token of thine honour else,

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: That thou wilt use the wars as thy redress

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: And not as our confusion, all thy powers

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: Shall make their harbour in our town, till we

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: Have seal'd thy full desire.

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Then there's my glove;

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Descend, and open your uncharged ports:

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Those enemies of Timon's and mine own

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Whom you yourselves shall set out for reproof

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Fall and no more: and, to atone your fears

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: With my more noble meaning, not a man

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Shall pass his quarter, or offend the stream

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Of regular justice in your city's bounds,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: But shall be render'd to your public laws

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: At heaviest answer.

speaker: Both
text_entry: 'Tis most nobly spoken.

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Descend, and keep your words.

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: The Senators descend, and open the gates

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Enter Soldier

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: My noble general, Timon is dead;

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: Entomb'd upon the very hem o' the sea;

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: And on his grave-stone this insculpture, which

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: With wax I brought away, whose soft impression

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: Interprets for my poor ignorance.

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: [Reads the epitaph]  'Here lies a

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: wretched corse, of wretched soul bereft:

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Seek not my name: a plague consume you wicked

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: caitiffs left!

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Here lie I, Timon; who, alive, all living men did hate:

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Pass by and curse thy fill, but pass and stay

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: not here thy gait.'

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: These well express in thee thy latter spirits:

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Though thou abhorr'dst in us our human griefs,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Scorn'dst our brain's flow and those our

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: droplets which

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: From niggard nature fall, yet rich conceit

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Taught thee to make vast Neptune weep for aye

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: On thy low grave, on faults forgiven. Dead

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Is noble Timon: of whose memory

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Hereafter more. Bring me into your city,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: And I will use the olive with my sword,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Make war breed peace, make peace stint war, make each

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Prescribe to other as each other's leech.

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Let our drums strike.

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Exeunt
